items.sentence: It\'s not Tom who needs protection. It\'s me.
Did you buy the painting you were looking at?
Did you do anything interesting last weekend?
Tom put the dirty dishes in the kitchen sink.
Would Tom accept your help if you offered it?
Would anyone mind if I turned on some lights?
Would you go to Boston if you had the chance?
We met while we were both visiting Australia.
We need to let our students be more creative.
I found this ring on the street this morning.
I can never get my son to eat any vegetables.
Tom seems to be unwilling to lower the price.
Tom sensed something bad was going to happen.
I thought I was never going to see Tom again.
I\'ve promised Tom I wouldn\'t do that again.
Tom says he doesn\'t have time to swim today.
Tom says he isn\'t willing to take any risks.
Tom usually only wears glasses when he reads.
Tom wanted Mary to tell him her phone number.
Mary wouldn\'t tell me her boyfriend\'s name.
